headline: How Investors May Respond To Costco Wholesale (COST) Tariff Refund Lawsuits And Digital Expansion Investments
summary: In recent months, Costco Wholesale has moved to recoup import taxes through lawsuits after the Supreme Court struck down many of President Donald Trump’s tariffs, while continuing to grow its global warehouse footprint and invest in digital tools like membership scanning and a Costco Digital Wallet. An important angle is that Costco largely absorbed these tariff costs to protect members on price, so successful refund claims could meaningfully affect its cash position without having...

headline: RF-SMART Reaches 2,800 NetSuite WMS Customers Across 40+ Countries
summary: RF-SMART, a leading warehouse management system (WMS) provider for NetSuite, announced it has reached 2,800 customers across 40+ countries, earning a spot on G2's 2026 Best Software Awards for Supply Chain and Logistics Products. Their Built-for-NetSuite warehouse management platform scales across operations of all sizes: from Shopify and Etsy sellers managing 20 SKUs with less than 100 orders per day, to highly regulated enterprise facilities managing 60,000+ SKUs and processing thousands of da

headline: FedEx says it will return to customers any refunds it gets back from Trump's illegal tariffs
summary: Delivery company FedEx said in a statement on Thursday that it will return any tariff refund it might get to shippers and customers who paid them.  The statement came after FedEx filed suit in the U.S. Court of International Trade to request a refund on what it paid for tariffs set by President Donald Trump under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.  On Friday, the Supreme Court ruled that the IEEPA tariffs are illegal.

On Friday, the Supreme Court ruled that the IEEPA tariffs are illegal.

headline: FedEx, Costco, Goodyear: Companies Race to Get Tariff Money Back
summary: 1,800 (at least) That's the number of companies that have filed lawsuits seeking refunds on President Trump's tariffs, many of which the Supreme Court has struck down. Most—including well-known names like Costco and Goodyear Tire & Rubber—filed ahead of the Supreme Court ruling.
